thread.title: USA Men's Basketball picked seventh, Williams tabbed to all-SBC team
thread.title_full: USA Men's Basketball picked seventh, Williams tabbed to all-SBC team

author: USA Athletic Media Relations
title: USA Men's Basketball picked seventh, Williams tabbed to all-SBC team
text:
Comments Brad Puckett/USA Athletic Media Relations 
University of South Alabama junior Ken Williams was selected to the Preseason All-Sun Belt Conference Men's Basketball Team, and the Jaguars were voted to finish seventh in the coaches' poll, the league announced Tuesday morning. 
Williams earns preseason recognition from the conference for the first time and comes on the heels of being a second-team pick after the 2014-15 campaign. 
Last season the Houston, Texas native ranked eighth in the Sun Belt in scoring average (15.7 ppg) and 3-point percentage (.370), second in 3-pointers (2.6 pg) and ninth in free-throw percentage (.791), and became the 21st player in school history to have 500 points in a season; his total of 519 is 17th in school history and fourth-most among all sophomores. 
Williams' accuracy beyond the arc led to 87 triples which is fifth in a single season at South Alabama and a sophomore record. 
for the full story.
